intro: Alysicarpus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf alysicarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are enclosed in a pod and can be used in traditional medicine, although it is not widely cultivated for agricultural purposes.
